content.description: Great crack climb for the Needles although a bit chossy and rough on the hands. Climbs the left facing corner up through a physical bulge then easier crack to the top of flake. We made a belay here, and supposedly the route continues to the right, up a shallow groove to the top. Deterred by poor rock quality and no protection we opted to needles style rap of the flake.
content.protection: Standard rack with a few doubles on finger and hand sizes. Not sure if there is any fixed gear on the second pitch...?
content.location: On the S side of spire, just left of needles eye-like hole, climb the left facing corner. Single rope rap off of top. Or NSR after first pitch.

climbs.name: A Farce to be Reckoned With
climbs.fa: Kevin Bein, Paul Piana, Robert Berger, Barbara Devine 8/13/80

content.description: Stunning looking line when viewed from the road. This bold, but safe, lead should be ticked by every hard needler. Follow the hand size flakes, on the E aspect of the spire, to a left leaning fracture with a pin. Take the large horizontal back right to a hanging flake and clip the first bolt. Rest and build up the courage to punch it for the next bolt, 25' up. Hardware was replaced by BHCC a few years ago.
content.protection: Single rack to BD #3 or #4   2 bolts   1 pin   Chain anchors
content.location: Start on left facing flake on the E face. Single 60m rap.

content.description: This is the proud isolated spire that stands to the W, across the gully from Needles Eye. Conn route established June 22nd, 1952.
